DnD/CAMPAIN/History/THE-STORY.title: THE STORY
DnD/CAMPAIN/History/THE-STORY.content:
World
The world of Khalhia is a peaceful country where Both man and animal could live in harmony. Despite being split up in three main islands the ruling has been run between 3 families for the past 500 years without a problem. Some say they have achieved national peace, Others… not so much and say those royal families are just blinded by the power and try to oppress anyone who claims they are wrong. Those three families you ask? well lets say normally you would not think they could work together as their interests and specialties differ quite a bit.
Inhabitants
Take the Wilwyn Family. A tribe of Elves and Wood-elves who decided to join hands after their first War with the dragonborns in the hopes of fending of any other threads to their forest. Living high in the most West forest, the Silverveil Forest. A giant forest where you can only find your way if you are deemed worthy of the Royal family otherwise the forest would forbid you from ever leaving. Dying and becoming food for the forest to grow bigger. Tales say that in the last 20 years alone over 30 persons went missing last seen near the forest.

Next up we have our Dragonborn family, Lun, Who decided that one of the island would be theirs. Specializing in hand to hand combat and a fighting style that resembles a Warlock, most people tend to be a little tense every time they meet one as they know that this means business. Their island, fitting called Dragon’s roost, resembled the head of a dragon. although no real dragons have been spotted in the last 100 years people still believe that those dragons are the reasons why you can hear an ear-deafening roar when passing close to the island

the last Family of the three are us, the humans. while there have been a couple of minor changes of our royal family, for the last 15 years it has been our beloved Queen, Emmalynn Chern, who has been sitting on the throne. Specializing in Magic and arcana our queen has started multiple schools dedicated to researching the use of mana and other means of using magic.

DnD/CAMPAIN/World/Country/Cities--and--T.title: Grimwel Town
DnD/CAMPAIN/World/Country/Cities--and--T.content:
General Info
Grimwel is a small, coastal Town near the southern edge of the kingdom of Khalhia. This Town is a great place to unwind after a long day of work and relax at the beach. drink some ale at the local tavern or go on a walk in the nearby forest, the choice is yours. The Townsfolk are friendly and welcoming and love to hear about stories from other places in the kingdom.

Stores & Hospitality
Grimwel Has a range of different stores ranging from simple general stores such as ‘Ravens Nest’ and ‘Rosebush Bloom’.
But also stores more suited for adventurers.
They have a Blacksmith for all your repairs and weapons
with a friendly smith called Dufri who came all the way from his hometown
But also a great Tavern, The Rising sun, where they have their own home-made Ale from the wheat fields surrounding the town. Or their Shepherd’s Pie which they cook right in front of you for the authentic experience.
If you want, go and take a look at the quest board they have in the back of the tavern. there might be something you’re interested in and a great way to get some extra gold pieces.

So what are you waiting for? Go and take a little break. eat a nice Shepherd’s Pie in the rising sun. or get your weapon’s repaired at the Ironforge Anvil.
Or just enjoy the sun from the beach, Who are we to judge.
— Yours truly
T.S, your traveling Correspondent
